content.description:
Directions: Suggested time - 5 minutes. 

When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must:

- write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers

AND

-- translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin.

"Este duces, O, si qua via est, cursumque per auras
derigite in luco ubi pinguem dives opacat
ramus humum. Tuque, O, dubiis ne defice rebus,
diva parens." Sic effatus vestigia pressit
observans quae signa ferant, quo tendere pergant.

Aeneas is the speaker in the passage above.
content.question: To whom or what does the word duces (line 1) refer?

frqParts.text: To whom or what does the word duces (line 1) refer?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
